item.title: Big tree whitefoot terrace garage end, 4th August
item.description:

item.title: Four non-registered brown wheelie bins with mixed rubbish, 4th August
item.description:
For more than six weeks, these non-registered bins have been sitting on the pavement. They are partly filled with cut grass but have gathered other rubbish and won't be emptied or collected. Please empty or remove them.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Huge amount of rubbish, 4th August
item.description:
The whole green area from Wickham Lane and the entrance to Bostall Woods were absolutely covered in rubbish on Saturday. Clothes and blankets as well as beer cans and food rubbish. Looks as though people possibly sleeping rough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Rats in the ceiling, 4th August
item.description:
Can hear rats (I assume - too heavy to be mice) running in the ceiling
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Play Space Park at Village Green Road Crayford Kent, 4th August
item.description:
Regarding the Play Space Children's Park in Crayford Kent on Village Green Road, the Park really needs Public Toilets for the Children, there used to be a Toilet Block years ago, but has been completely knocked down. Please can this be looked at Urgently, this is definitely a MUST for the Park and the Children. Also, the Rubber Ground Flooring is in VERY POOR condition and I have seen many little children tripping over, even my own 3 year old tripped over on the Rubber Ground Flooring, it was not nice to see this happen to my child. Some of the Play Ground Equipment needs an Upgrade too, there are far too many UNSAFE areas and flooring to be URGENTLY seen to and fixing, I feel sorry for the little children as this Park is a Lovely Park to go to with our children. Please can ALL this be looked at URGENTLY and have some Public Toilets put in place. I would be So Grateful. Mrs Vicky Buckley (Parent to a 3 year old who loves the Park) and on behalf of many other parents who attend the Park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Green Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noise caused from broken drain cover, 4th August
item.description:
The drain cover in the road is broken, every time a vehicle drives over it it makes a loud noise. It is causing me to not sleep or be able to concentrate in my flat. Please come and fix it asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
